snippet.title: ムーンボールマジック (ニンテンド ファミリーコンピュータ ディスクシステム) ゲームプレー / Moon Ball Magic (FDS) Gameplay
snippet.description:
So it's January again... and I figured to show an interesting flipper game called Moon Ball Magic made by a guy called Mark Flint (System Sacom) for the Famicom Disk System.
To my knowledge this is the only other pinball game on the system apart from Nintendo's Pinball port in 1989.
The game works well, and it is noteworthy to mention that this game has some of the most interesting title screen sequences I ever saw on a FDS title. The music is pretty decent (apart from the fact that the whole music engine is stored in the FDS's RAM) for the most part.
I got stuck on Stage 3 sadly, but the good thing is that the game has infinitive continues.
For more info check out: https://strategywiki.org/wiki/Moon_Ball_Magic
